com.versant.util.backup
Interface RestoreListener

public interface RestoreListener

To signal and recover from different recoverable error conditions and warnings while restoring database.

Method Summary
 boolean anotherLevelQuery()
          Queries the user if another level backup needs to be restored or not.
 boolean backupNotLatest()
          Warns the user that a more recent backup of the particular level was made than the one specified.
 boolean copyLogicalLog()
          Queries the user to copy the logical log file or not.
 boolean couldNotOpenDevice(RestoreVisitor visitor)
          Get invoked when an existing backup device could not be opened for reading.
 boolean dbModifiedAfterRestore()
          Warns the user that the database has been modified since the previous level of restore was done and he should consider restarting from level 0.
 boolean getPathOfLogicalLog(RestoreVisitor visitor)
          Queries the user to find the location of logical log in order to copy it to some other location.
 boolean getPathToCopyLogicalLog(RestoreVisitor visitor)
          Queries the user to get new path to which logical log will be copied.

          Warns the user that copy of the logical log already exists at specified position.

          Get invoked when next log archive is needed.
 boolean restoreLevel2()
          Warns the user that he would probably need to restore level 2 backup after the current restore is over.
 boolean restorePreviousLevel()
          Warns the user that before restoring this level backup, user first restore previous level backup.

Method Detail

copyLogicalLog

boolean copyLogicalLog()
Queries the user to copy the logical log file or not.

Returns:
true if the logical log file should be copied, false otherwise.

getPathOfLogicalLog

boolean getPathOfLogicalLog(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Queries the user to find the location of logical log in order to copy it to some other location. The method is expected to set the path of logical log as a log file.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the log file information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the path of logical log is set, false to get logical log file from default location i.e. from DB directory itself.

getPathToCopyLogicalLog

boolean getPathToCopyLogicalLog(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Queries the user to get new path to which logical log will be copied. The method is expected to set the new path to copy the logical log.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the log file information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the new path to copy logical log is set, false to copy the log file to default location.

mountNextDeviceForNextLevel

boolean mountNextDeviceForNextLevel(int level,
                                    RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when device on which another level backup has been taken, is needed while restoring the databse.

Parameters:
level - The next level on which the backup is taken.
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

mountNextDevice

boolean mountNextDevice(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when next backup device is needed. The method is expected to set the filename of the next backup device.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

couldNotOpenDevice

boolean couldNotOpenDevice(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when an existing backup device could not be opened for reading. The method is expected to set the filename of the correct backup device.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

mountNextLogDevice

boolean mountNextLogDevice(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when next log archive is needed. The method is expected to set the filename of the correct log archive.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

anotherLevelQuery

boolean anotherLevelQuery()
Queries the user if another level backup needs to be restored or not.

Returns:
true if another level backup needs to be restored, false otherwise.

wrongFileFormat

boolean wrongFileFormat(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the file on an existing backup device is not of proper format. The method is expected to set the filename of the file with proper format.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongFileVolume

boolean wrongFileVolume(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the file on an existing backup device does not have proper volume. The method is expected to set the filename of the file with proper volumes.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongFileLabel

boolean wrongFileLabel(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the file on an existing backup device does not have proper label. The method is expected to set the filename of the file with proper label.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongFileVersion

boolean wrongFileVersion(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the file on an existing backup device does not have proper version. The method is expected to set the filename of the file with proper version.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongByteOrdering

boolean wrongByteOrdering(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the file on an existing backup device does not have proper byte ordering. The method is expected to set the filename of the file with proper byte ordering.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongFileBlock

boolean wrongFileBlock(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when an existing backup device has wrong block of file. The method is expected to set the filename with the proper blocks.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongBackupDevice

boolean wrongBackupDevice(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the file on an existing backup device does not have backup of the specified database name. The method is expected to set the proper filename of the file on which backup of the specified database is taken.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongLogArchive

boolean wrongLogArchive(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the specified log archive does not belong to the specified database name. The method is expected to set the proper filename of the file on which logging of the specified database is done.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

wrongLogArchiveSequenceNumber

boolean wrongLogArchiveSequenceNumber(RestoreVisitor visitor)
Get invoked when the log archive file sequence number does not match the requested one. The method is expected to set the proper filename of the file on which logging of the specified database is done sequentially.

Parameters:
visitor - The visitor object where the device information needs to be set.
Returns:
true if the next device information is set using the visitor object, false if the restore needs to be aborted.

logicalLogCopyAlreadyExists

boolean logicalLogCopyAlreadyExists()
Warns the user that copy of the logical log already exists at specified position.

Returns:
true to continue restore, false to abort it.

backupNotLatest

boolean backupNotLatest()
Warns the user that a more recent backup of the particular level was made than the one specified.

Returns:
true to continue restore, false to abort it.

restoreLevel2

boolean restoreLevel2()
Warns the user that he would probably need to restore level 2 backup after the current restore is over.

Returns:
true to continue restore, false to abort it.

dbModifiedAfterRestore

boolean dbModifiedAfterRestore()
Warns the user that the database has been modified since the previous level of restore was done and he should consider restarting from level 0.

Returns:
true to continue restore, false to abort it.

restorePreviousLevel

boolean restorePreviousLevel()
Warns the user that before restoring this level backup, user first restore previous level backup.

Returns:
true to continue restore, false to abort it.
